meanings.definition: To cover or decorate the top of something
meanings.sent1: She topped the cake with colorful sprinkles.
meanings.sent2: The chef topped the pizza with melted cheese.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel topped its nest with fluffy cotton candy.
meanings.sent4: Her smile topped off her beautiful face like a crown.
meanings.sent5: The cherry on top of the sundae topped it perfectly.

meanings.definition: To be higher than something else
meanings.sent1: The mountain topped all the other peaks in the range.
meanings.sent2: The skyscraper topped the surrounding buildings.
meanings.sent3: The giraffe topped the other animals in height at the zoo.
meanings.sent4: His test score topped everyone else's in the class.
meanings.sent5: The sunflower topped the fence, reaching for the sky.

meanings.definition: To reach the highest point or level
meanings.sent1: The thermometer topped 100 degrees in the heatwave.
meanings.sent2: The water level topped the dam, causing a flood.
meanings.sent3: The excitement in the room topped when the surprise guest arrived.
meanings.sent4: His speed topped all the other runners in the race.
meanings.sent5: The applause topped as the singer hit the high note.
